projects.title: W3nity
projects.shortDescription: All-in-one Web3-enabled collaboration platform for freelancing, events, and real-time community chat.
projects.fullDescription: W3nity is a unified Web3-enabled collaboration platform combining a freelancing marketplace with on-chain escrow, event management with NFT ticketing, and real-time community chat. The project includes frontend (React + TypeScript + Tailwind), a Node/Express backend, smart contracts (Solidity + Hardhat), and real-time features using Socket.IO.
implementation: Frontend SPA built with React + TypeScript and Tailwind CSS with component-based architecture
Backend REST API using Node.js and Express with MongoDB (Mongoose)
Real-time chat built on Socket.IO (WebSockets)
Smart contracts (Escrow, ERC-721 ticketing) developed in Solidity and tested with Hardhat
MetaMask + wallet integration (Wagmi/Ethers) and deployment-ready frontend (Vercel)

projects.title: Hogwarts OS
projects.shortDescription: A Harry-Potter–themed Linux Mint based OS and modular toolset — immersive UI, gamification, and AI-powered assistant.
projects.fullDescription: Hogwarts OS reimagines the desktop experience with house-based personalization, spell-based terminal commands, an Electron-based Marauder’s Map file explorer, AI-powered portrait assistant, and gamification layers (XP, house points). It ships both as a full ISO distribution and modular installable components for Linux Mint.
implementation: Full ISO build based on Linux Mint Cinnamon with branded boot and desktop customizations
Modular apps (Sorting Hat, Marauder's Map, Owl Post) implemented as Electron/Python tools
Spell-based terminal wrapper that maps friendly commands to shell commands
AI-powered portrait assistant integrated via Agent AI / Akash Chat
Gamification layer with XP, house points, and unlockables

projects.title: BookSwap
projects.shortDescription: Campus-focused Android app for peer-to-peer book exchanges with listings, auctions, and real-time chat.
projects.fullDescription: BookSwap is an Android application built to facilitate textbook and novel exchange within college campuses. It supports user authentication, book listings (including auctions and timers), image uploads via Cloudinary, and one-to-one real-time messaging between buyers and sellers using Firebase services.
implementation: MVVM-structured Android app with Activities & Fragments for core screens
Authentication and user management with Firebase Authentication
Book listings stored in Firestore with images hosted on Cloudinary
Real-time one-to-one chat implemented using Firebase Realtime Database
Auction-style listings with timer UI and profile management

projects.title: GlobeTrotter
projects.shortDescription: Intelligent, collaborative travel planner with AI itinerary generation, budgeting tools, and visual trip sharing.
projects.fullDescription: GlobeTrotter is a platform that simplifies multi-city trip planning through user-friendly features like AI-powered itinerary suggestions, cost estimation, visualization dashboards, and collaborative sharing. Built with a React frontend and Node/Express backend, it includes secure authentication, budget tracking, admin tools, and Cloudinary media storage.
implementation: React frontend with Vite, styled using Tailwind CSS and Material UI components
Node.js and Express.js backend providing REST APIs for authentication, trip CRUD, and AI integration
MongoDB with Mongoose for storing users, trips, activities, budgets
Authentication handled via JWT and Google OAuth, with secure password hashing via Bcrypt
File uploads managed through Cloudinary, email notifications via Gmail SMTP
Deployment: frontend on Vercel, backend on Render
Admin dashboard implemented for user and content management with analytics
AI-powered itinerary suggestions, budgeting cost breakdowns, timeline and calendar visualizations

projects.title: NoobsterDSA
projects.shortDescription: A productivity web app to log, track, and analyze DSA and competitive programming practice.
projects.fullDescription: NoobsterDSA centralizes DSA & CP practice tracking: daily logs, contest tracking, weekly goals, analytics dashboards, and auto-tagging of problems (platform/difficulty). Built for learners with a clean, gamified UI and PWA support.
implementation: Logging system for daily practice with metadata (date, topic, problems, time, notes)
Contest performance tracker and weekly goals with reflections
Analytics dashboards: heatmaps, time-distribution charts, and progress summaries
Auto-tagging from problem URLs and markdown-enabled notes
PWA features and responsive design for mobile/desktop
